Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: *wam feta (tomato, anchiovy, caper, roasted pepper, olives, pita bread; omg!!!!!! I loved this appetizer! The acidity of everything went so well with the tangy, melted feta cheese. The achiovy took this dish to another level though, loved it! great portion size as well, definitely not cheating you out)*grilled octopus, bean salad (HOLD THE PHONE! the grilled octopus had such an amazing tenderness to it, it was meaty, soft and not tough at all like some other places that overcook their octopus. such a great smokey flavor from the grill. the bean salad with the vinaigrette complimented the seafood so well. could eat this all day!)*sheep's milk dumplings (the dumplings were amazing!!!!!! they were like marshmallows in a bath of garlicky, tomatoey goodness. I loved the texture of the dumplings, so soft and fluffy. the spicy lamb sausage was so good!! can definitely taste the lamb meat but it wasn't gamey at all; the sausage was small and chopped into small rounds that was found throughout the dish; the sauce was absolutely delicious!!!!!!!!!! please ask for more bread to soak it up, don't waste this sauce!!!!! this dish is such a comfort food; it's filling but not overwhelming like heavy pasta dishes)This place is adorable with their decor. The entrance is nice with the bar area and the formal dining area is cozy. Service is good and friendly. The bathroom is surprisingly so clean haha. In regards to their food, such great quality and so fresh. I would go back here in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Author: N P.
Reviews.Content: When we go to a restaurant we hope to not only enjoy the food, but also to enjoy the overall experience. and when we leave a restaurant, we usually ask- will we be back? The answer with Kefi is no, here's why...we thought the food was ok,  but not memorable, but the experience they delivered was just bland and plain boring.First the good: ..appetizers- the Cypriot salad was a refreshing, very enjoyable light summer salad,  the grilled octopus is good- not chewy, perfect char, with a touch of lemon. Service was efficient and pleasant. Ok so what is not to like? The main dishes we ordered were clumsily presented, over stuffed with chips, and a soggy salad like you would get at a college food truck. The entrees- chicken souvlaki and the lamb burger were just ok. Our biggest dislike was the way the restaurant looked and was laid out. Tables jammed together, hard services, little in the way of decor that reminds you that you are eating at a Greek Restaurant, in other words it has ZERO Greek charm, soul or ambiance. To make matters worse, we were sent to the Kefi basement to eat (even though there were plenty of open tables upstairs). And no surprise here, the Kefi basement smells like ....a musty basement. Also, when sitting downstairs, expect to be in very close proximity with other people (who were banished to the musty basement), and expect to watch the kitchen staff move dirty dishes back and forth while you eat. I mean it was a saddest spot, bleak and bland...not even a little candle to cheer us up. Needless to say, we skipped desert to go up for air.

Reviews.Author: Kristen T.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is a great place to go, especially if you're from a place without good Greek food-- like me. My family and I tend to eat family style, and everything I tasted was fantastic. My only complaint is that I had too much of their tasty bread and dipping sauces to finish my meal!

Reviews.Author: Trisha A.
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. Went there for brunch a couple of weeks ago and had a whole grilled Branzino. It was cooked to perfection that it just melt in my mouth.

Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: The food and the service were top notch.  We enjoyed the combinations of meats, cheeses and the presentation.  The staff was funny, informative and friendly.Will be back!!

Reviews.Author: Jaci H.
Reviews.Content: Kefi certainly has a reputation for good food and it's nice to know it really lives up to the hype.My UWS friends brought me here yesterday for an early dinner at around 6:30pm.  It's a large space and were thrilled to be seated without issue.  I had no idea there was so much room, be sure to check out the downstairs. Our server was extremely helpful, cheerful and knowledgable with the food and wines being offered.  He recommended a delicious, refreshing and affordable ($30 per bottle) white wine. We skipped appetizers in hopes of enjoying dessert - which we didn't because we were far too full from dinner.  Will have to come back since the desserts looked divine. I ordered the Chicken Thigh Souvlaki special, which was unbelievably delicious. Tender, perfectly grilled chunks of chicken thigh were presented on wooden skewers.  It was a very hearty portion and each bite was pure bliss with the accompanying pita bread, Greek salad (which they were kind enough to present without feta cheese) and a delicious rice.  The salad was fresh and flavorful with lots of olives, tomatoes, onions and peppers.  Loved the salad dressing! The rice was amazing with a butter flavor and spinach.  I literally couldn't stop eating... and ended up cleaning my plate.  If you could have seen the food baby!   I could have easily taken home about a third of the dish but opted to pigging out while the food was fresh.  My friends also thoroughly enjoyed the dinners, ordered the same as me.  We were thrilled with Kefi and will definitely return in the near future.  Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Conrad N.
Reviews.Content: We got there around 1:30pm and the place was packed!!  It's 4th of july long weekend, and fifa was on with germany vs france.  They have massive tv that broadcast the game, so that might explain why its so packed.We ordered grilled octopus, it came with chickpea salad.  omg.  I loved it!!!!  I also ordered a chicken souvlaki wrap with a side of kefi salad.  It is a lot of food!Normally those sandwich comes with home made chips and salad...but I didnt want any chips and ot was perfect for me.  My husband loved the chips too.I will definitely go back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Kai N.
Reviews.Content: Walked in on a Monday night. We were able to walk in and seated with no reservations. It was busy, so the servers gave us ample time and extra bread and water before our order was taken. We ordered the braised rabbit pasta, lamb shank, chicken skewers special, and the grilled octopus for an appetizer. The lamb was flavorless. I've never had rabbit before, but it taste more or less like the lamb shank. Yup, unfortunately the chicken skewers is the best plate on the table. We asked for the dessert menu, but nothing jump out at us. Plus, our main course did not leave us wanting more, so we left.The place looks better than the food taste. Would only come back if I'm in the area next time for a drink at the marble top bar with ESPN on the screens.

Reviews.Author: Jeff O.
Reviews.Content: HOW HAVE I NEVER REVIEWED KEFI I'M SORRY KEFI FORGIVE ME.OK deep breaths. Straight-up, we've dined here around 25 or 30 times, and we're the kind of people who visit a restaurant twice only if it's really good. So yeah.I'm not going to get into specifics because you can't go wrong - if a dish sounds good to you, trust me, it will be good. OK one example - even the damn tzatziki sauce will blow your mind. Tzatziki is one of those things you think can only be so good and is the same everywhere, but you're freaking wrong, it can pretty much change your life if you infuse it with unicorns and rainbows, as I'm pretty sure Kefi does.Last point: the prices are crazy reasonable, like unreasonably reasonable. Win win win.

Reviews.Author: Erica D.
Reviews.Content: Our server was so fantastic tonight. We came with a group of 12 and he had just the right amount of helpfulness and "leave us alone-ness" that we needed. He made excellent wine recommendations, excellent food pacing recommendations and made our gathering just right. I was looking for a place with great service, good food and a quiet room. We sat downstairs in the "back room". It was noisy on a Sat night but not overly so. Food was a little too oily.

Reviews.Author: Alisa G.
Reviews.Content: Tasty and reasonably-priced.  We ordered 4 meze, no entrees or dessert (although I wish I'd looked at the dessert menu before we decided to go out for froyo!).  The Greek sausage was the standout, but the pickled beet salad and warm feta dish were also excellent.  The only dish that was a disappointing was the grilled calamari with beans. Way too many beans (chickpeas), and not enough flavor.  Mint cocktail was also delish!  The servers, runners, and bussers were friendly and attentive.  We sat downstairs, which I would recommend, b/c it's much quieter.  I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Noura Andréa A.
Reviews.Content: I love Greek/Mediterranean food. And given that I'm from Lebanon, I know a thing or two about the food. I was pleasantly surprised with the food at KEFI.I ordered the eggplant and bulgur fritters, with tahini sauce and pita bread. Whenever I read the word "fritters", I get chills and expect a very greasy and crunchy food that will make me feel sick all night long. Tahini sauce is my enemy because they just put too much of it. And your "falafel" ends up swimming in the sauce.I ordered the plate with fingers crossed and got a beautiful result. I got a gluten-free (yes that's an option) pita bread and some tahini very lightly (yet enough for flavor) spread on it. The fritters were marvelous! Lightly crunchy on the outside and so sweet and tender on the inside. Your knife just slides through it. The salad is well seasoned, nothing is too salty or greasy.The sandwiches are served with salad and chips. I didn't try the chips because that's not my cup of tea.The people with me were also enjoying their food, fish and meat.This is a place I would definitely go to again.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: I was really expecting this meal to wow me but i didn't get that feeling. Everything was good, no real complaints. The sangria was terrible though. We all kinda laughed about the taste, comparing it to HI-C. Pretty loud inside on a Friday night. Loud for my parents, but would be better for a night out with friends. If you want less noise I suggest trying downstairs. Service was decent. We ordered an appetizer without Pine Nuts, specifically mentioning an allergy to the waiter but when the dumplings came out I spotted a pine nut luckily before my boyfriend ate it. No real apology, they just replaced it. Going to stick with Bodrum because nothing compares!

Reviews.Author: Eponine J.
Reviews.Content: Before 6pm, they offer a prix fixe dinner menu for $17 which includes an app, entree and dessert. The two of us ordered mussels, meatball, branzino (+5 extra charge), pork medallions, walnut cake and rice pudding from the prix fixe and selection of spreads to start with. Everything was perfectly cooked but the selection of spreads and branzino definitely stood out.They also have a three-course chef tasting menu for $35, on top of which you can add a pasta course for an extra $7.

Reviews.Author: Eytan S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing dinner specialties that will fill your mouth with flavor! Get the sheep milk dumplings, feel like pillows in your mouth. I'm full!Bon appetite

Reviews.Author: Risa H.
Reviews.Content: Came here to eat one night, found the place through none other than Yelp!  I love lamb and anything spicy, so I had to try the Sheep's Milk Dumplings with Spicy Lamb Sausage.  It was VERY flavorful, a bit on the salty side, but still delicious.  I would have preferred an atmosphere with not so much lighting, but the food was still good.  Waiter brought the food out quicker than expected.  Bathrooms are located downstairs and there is a separate dining area downstairs with more of the ambiance I like in a restaurant (there was a private party down there).  Would come back to eat if I was in the area!

Reviews.Author: Joanna L.
Reviews.Content: I loved the way this place use to be....they gutted it since the last time i went. Its way more modern which is cool too but i was more of a fan of the old Kefi..but that's just me. The hostess was ok with my group. We didn't have a reservation so she said it would be 20min. Cool... But she didn't tell us where to wait or if we got a buzzer or how it would work when it was our turn to be sat. Very awkward. There's sooooo many restaurants in NYC with their own methods of seating and hostessing that I feel its the hosts responsibility to let the guests know what to do while they wait and where to go...right?? Anyways... I asked where to go and she said we can have a seat at the bar or go outside. We went to the bar and sat there...we were going to order drinks from the bartender and pay for them upfront before we got sat but the bartender was clearly under the impression that we were just taking up seats in her bar while waiting for our table because she never even looked at us...awkward again because If we didn't want drinks we would of waited outside for our table.We got our table in about 15min which was nice but then to cut this review short....we got sat next to a table that was being very rude to the waiter and so therefore, the waiter came to our table to take our order and drop off drinks ONCE...he stayed away from our area because of the other table...with that being said...you can imagine how asking for the check and paying out went...not well. I'll definitely be back for grandmas meatball.... AND to give this place another shot because our situation was unique so its only fair to try it out again...

Reviews.Author: Lesley C.
Reviews.Content: Loved the lamb chaps! Cooked to perfection.

Reviews.Author: Victoria B.
Reviews.Content: Great food, the sheep milk dumplings everyone is raving about is amazing, grilled octopus tender and smoky, dips taste authentic. The vegetable side was quite oily, but still tasty. An allover good experience, will be back for the dumplings.

Reviews.Author: A P.
Reviews.Content: Well this place was insanely disappointing.  This was a Yelp fail... don't know what other reviewers were doing but wow it was bad.  Menu was not descriptive and we have food allergies so this is a problem.  We got a dish that didn't list tomato where it was the primary ingredient.  Instead of being polite and offering to take the dish away and replace with something else the incompetent waitress argued over whether the menu listed tomato for the dish - which it didn't - she confirmed later.  She slid the fish onto a plate and told us to pick around and then brought tough broccoli as a substitute.  She was just really bad.  She also brought a salad with peppers and again we can't eat those and was annoyed when I sent it back.  The waitress did almost nothing and the poor bus boys did most of the work.  We were charged for the full $18.95 fish even though we couldn't eat half of it.  My chicken with skin, on the bone, was extremely dry.  Impressive that someone can fail at making roast chicken.  DO NOT GO HERE or be prepared to be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Mediterranean food here.  To start we had an octopus appetizer and a several spreads with pita. For our main course we had a whole fish with broccoli rabe and a lemon chicken dish. I would order the fish again. We are looking forward to exploring the menu.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious and affordable would be the two best words to describe this place. We ordered about a half dozen appetizers to share between two couples, and every last thing was delicious. The grilled octopus though was, by far, the highlight. Perfectly cooked, slightly tender and well seasoned, it was maybe the best grilled octopus I've ever had. Two bottles of wine and a table full of food, and our bill was less than $130 total. We'll be back.

Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: Incredible. Greek food is underrated and Kefi is a gem in the Upper West Side. This place simply blows Taverna straight out of the Mediterranean waters. The friendly, attentive staff made sure we were always taken care of and there seems to be plenty of space (multiple floors). Never order chicken at a Greek restaurant...that said, I personally don't eat lamb but can attest to the excellent seafood quality. The grilled octopus was tender and fresh...almost tasted like some type of forbidden land protein. The pita appetizer is a home run too. Multiple difference sauces, all incredibly flavorful. Free refill on the basket just in case too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Sarah F.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like it here but found the food lacking. My octopus appetizer was burnt pretty badly, and was sitting on a bed of chick peas so heavily covered in parsley I was picking it out of my teeth for a whole day. I'm not sure that the swordfish I ordered was fully cooked. I had a pretty hard time cutting into it, and it was fairly translucent and clear looking in the middle as opposed to white and cooked. The price was reasonable but I would rather spend a little more to really enjoy my food. Great selection of Greek wines, though.

Reviews.Author: Kendrick W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious.  That's my memory of this place.  I came on a stormy night, an hour late meeting my friends because my plane was so delayed and this place quickly made me forget it all.  The moment I sat down, the waitress came right over, took my drink order and even recommended some dishes.  I had the sheep milk ricotta ravioli and it was like butter in my mouth.  So creamy and good.  My only complaint was that I felt the portion was a little small, which is unusual for greek places.  But absolutely tasty.  Also the meatballs.  Perfection.  I was a little underwhelmed by the Sangria, but other than that no real complaints.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: If your in the UWS the place to go for Greek food would be here. Large restaurant with a downstairs and upstairs. Decor is standard and doesn't wow you and even with a reservation prepare for a bit of a wait.You come here for the greek food. Great apps with hummus and yogurt and their Octopus was grilled perfectly. Had the pressed chicken and it was made great and very flavorful with a bit of crunch from the pressing. If in the area i would stop in again.

Reviews.Author: Alisa L.
Reviews.Content: 1.5 years.  The approximate amount of time Zachary Taylor was in office, or the amount of time I went without Kefi due to its closure/being busy and no longer living in MoHi.The answer is both, but alas, absence did not make the heart grow fonder once we were reunited.To be fair, the food itself was decent, albeit not as good as I remembered.  The sheep's dumplings were merely okay but the sauce was very flavorful, just begging to be scooped up by an extra order of bread.  The lamb burger was also average at best, nothing special and honestly, there are many better burgers in the neighborhood.So far, the restaurant is probably earning a solid 3 stars, but then what merited the drop?The service, oh god, the service.  The food took something like 45 minutes to come, while dessert, which was nothing special and shouldn't have taken that long, took 20.  Any request required attempting to flag down a waiter, already incredibly difficult, and actually ensuring the waiter remembered your request by re-flagging him down and reminding him.  The ambiance was also lacking, especially in the basement.  There was an old moldy smell, though it was very faint, and the place just seemed unappealing.  Perhaps it was the lighting, or the setup of the basement, but this place has definitely lost its charm.

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch. If you're a feta fan + mussels fan, get the mussels for the appetizer. It was incredibly good, especially when you dip the bread in the sauce... woah man! We followed the yelper's recommendation and get ourselves the lamb shank. Very delicious, but because of how salty/flavorful the mussels were, it almost overpowered the taste of the lamb shank. So keep that in mind as you're making your choice. My brother had the kefi burger. That thing is HUGE. Not a fan that you have to add money for cheese (who does that?!) but when you have an option to add feta in a burger... go for it! I like this a lot! Cool interior, we had a very early lunch so no one was there yet so that was nice since my family and I wanted to get away from the business of Manhattan... we're tourists...you see...

Reviews.Author: Steve R.
Reviews.Content: I had a quite different experience from other Yelpers, because Kefi is way below par... somewhere in the double bogey range. If you must go, I suggest insisting on sitting upstairs, and if you cannot wait for a table there, leave. Downstairs is a loud, windowless, dining area where I felt herded in, like a tourist getting off a bus. In fact, the large groups sitting in another downstairs section, seemed to follow that description. The tables are small, crammed together and it is hard to hear your partner. Guests have to speak loud to be heard, so we couldn't help hearing what our neighbors were saying. It took 45 minutes to get appetizers. The often praised grilled octopus was tender, but it had no taste or brininess to it, as if you couldn't tell it ever came from the sea. Tasted like chicken. The warm feta was good, but I could do that at home. An hour in, we were told that they were out of dumplings, which was the sole reason we went there. Why wait an hour? FAIL. We finally got our good quality lamb chops, under-seasoned and over-grilled, poorly presented on a bed of greens in dire need of flavor. We should have listened to our neighborhood friends and hotel front desk people who didn't suggest Kefi. It really was a letdown.

Reviews.Author: Tara J.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch on a Saturday with my boyfriend, parents, and a friend, and was disappointed that the service and staff were so bad, it almost ruined the good food. First, due to miscommunication on our part, we made two reservations for 5 people. When we got there -on time-, there was no table available for us, and we had to wait for almost 40 minutes for a table to be cleared. How did they not plan for that? What's the point in making a reservation? The manager tried to help but didn't do anything to speed up the process.Then once we sat, it took forever for our waitress to get to us, and then even longer for our food to come out - even though by that time we had told the waitress we were in a rush because we had plans to get to. I ordered some kind of breakfast sandwich with eggs, cheese, tomato, and bacon, on a giant loaf of bread. This was the messiest sandwich I've ever eaten, and the bread was way too large. I had to cut it up just to manage it, but the flavors were delicious. Everyone else enjoyed their food, but also was disappointed by the service. Despite the awful service, I really enjoyed the food and I would give this a second chance.

Reviews.Author: Yon L.
Reviews.Content: Come here by 12pm for brunch and it won't be crowded. It starts getting hectic around 1pm. LOVED the Sheep Milk dumplings. The tomato basil lamb sauce complimented these little treasures so well! The Greek spread was also yums. Really fresh and on point. I can't seem to find it on their menu online, but there was a GREAT Prawns dish on a bed of some grain... I don't know what it's called so this is frustrating, but they were small round bits... larger than quinoa. Reallly well cooked prawns and the other stuff was delicious too. haha.Was not a fan of the Greek Meat and Potato omelette. It was huge but the eggs were overcooked and dry. The sausage was tasty though but this dish definitely went back half finished. Service was great until the 1pm rush. Then our Bottomless mimosas turned into no mimosas for half an hour. Talk about a buzz kill. I'd go back...earlier.

Reviews.Author: Rachel B.
Reviews.Content: Since moving to the UWS 10 months ago I had been waiting for Kefi to reopen. Many of my friends had recommended the place to me. So, I was thrilled when I managed to secure a reservation last Friday night. Maybe its because the place had been so hyped, but I wasn't overly impressed with my meal. It was good... but nothing I would run back for. The grilled octopus was probably the best dish we tried. But, the rapine was waaay too oily and my simple grilled fish also tasted bathed in oil and butter. The special pasta dish made with a pulled pork was also pretty darn good, but its not that hard to get a good pasta dish in this city.It was also packed that night and we felt a bit rushed by the waitstaff, but that's understandable on a Friday night, and forgivable. Although, jamming so many diners into such a small space and constantly having the waitstaff bump into you really isn't the most preferable way to enjoy a meal. They might want to take out a table, or 3 or 4. The dining room is just so packed.I'm going to give Kefi another try. Hopefully, they were just a bit off that night. And the next time I'll see what all the hype is about and enjoy a great meal.

Reviews.Author: lauren l.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!  Firstly, we sat at the bar to have drinks and snacks.   It was literally at least 5 minutes before we were acknowledged by the bartender.    She was busy, but a good bartender would know to at least say "Hello, be with you soon."  No.  She walked back and forth and didn't even glance at us.Next-the food.   The dips were BAD!  So surprising because these are not that difficult to get right.  We won't be going back there.

Reviews.Author: Kara L.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Saturday for dinner with my best friend, and the food was so amazing it made up for some of the restaurants weak points.Since the "remodel" kefi has less of a intimate feeling and more of a get in and get out vibe. The two top I sat at was SO close to the table next to us I felt like they were part of our conversation. Also, both my table, and the table next to us ordered appetizers that never came out. My friend and I ordered the tzatziki, hummus, lamb shank, and striped bass which were All amazing. Our grilled octopus never made it to the table, but I saw others eating it and it looked good. I also had a glass of red sangria which was awful, it reminded me of a cheap juice I drank when I was little.The food is worth checking out as long as they keep the idea of quality, not quantity in mind. Also, make a reservation, this place gets packed fast!

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: The food is not bad; it is no longer consistent and good.  The selection is still ... OK to good.  Those are now the only nice (nice-ish) things I can say about a restaurant I used to enjoy weekly, sometimes more often.   Kefi was damaged and spent a few months rebuilding.  When they were closed they lost nearly all of there staff ... and a restaurant takes a team like atmosphere to succeed.   I have been back to Kefi a few times since their reopening, brunch and dinner, and they have failed me every time.  They have problems from management to wait staff to bartenders.   It is a shame. The managment has consistently over booked and understaffed the restaurant while not having trained their staff adequately.  I feel sorry for the people that work there because they are not being given an environment to succeed, let alone excel.

Reviews.Author: P L.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance: This is a nice casual place to grab a bite to eat. Not pretentious and the staff was very nice and friendly. The manager also came up to us during our meal to make sure everything was okay and if we needed anything.The give bread at the table however since the bread is out before you sit down and seems to have been there for a bit, it was rock hard. We asked for fresher bread which they provided with no problem.We ordered the goat cheese dumplings with spicy lamb sausage-the sauce was very good and the dumplings were soft and pillowy and yummy. The only negative of the dish was the lamb sausage which was very hard and tasted funny.We also ordered the chicken sandwich and the chickpea fritter sandwich. Both were good and came with homemade chips and salad. Con: salad was a bit limp and overly covered with dressing.Overall, a good dining experience- you can be in and out in under an hour. I would go back again.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: This review is based not on the food, which was delicious, but some of the most disorganized and chaotic service ever.  Four of us arrived at 7 pm for a birthday dinner and soon after ordered drinks.  45 minutes later I had mine but my friends had not.  One had ordered a virgin bloody mary and the two others vodka on the rocks.  Not complicated.  About 7.55 our appetizers arrived.  Still no more drinks.  We were told after repeated requests that the bar, which was in front of us, was backed up and the waiter himself could not make the drinks.  There was one bartender.  Then waiters seemed to gather to try to sort the mess, the bartender left, and finally the manager stepped in, very late in the game.  We all got drinks about the time the entree arrived.  Why the manager did not see what was going on and step in we could not understand.  It was a train wreck.  And by the way our waiter, who was doing the best he could, delivered the vodka on the rocks with a lemon twist with a lime wedge instead.  Under the circumstances we felt lucky to have drinks at all.  Quite a shockingly bad experience for a good restaurant and not at all appropriate to the quality of the food which was great.

Reviews.Author: chip h.
Reviews.Content: The Octopus is still Amazing!!!!  Some people are complaining about the service but I'm sure as soon as the new servers become better seasoned that will no longer be an issue.  I am not a fan of the upstairs so I always have a few cocktails next door at Prohibition while I wait for a table downstairs.  Upstairs (very loud and congested), Downstairs (Cozy and much quieter).  The Lamb shank was still delicious and everyone at my table enjoyed their meal.  The service was a bit on the slow side but the guy was super friendly and trying his best so no big deal.  Love it......Sit downstairs.....Get the Octopus!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Tracey M.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place a lot. They're a little slow at the checkin desk... But they totally make up with it for the good fresh food and the robust menu. If you can get there before 6 o'clock they have a prefix menu that first $17 gets you an appetizer an entrée and a dessert. For New York -- that's amazing.

Reviews.Author: Erum R.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the hype is about. I came here for dinner one night with the hubby and was not pleased. You'd think they have an amazing menu because the wait was about 45 minutes for a Thursday night but it really was not so impressive.Husband had the chicken souvlaki sandwich which he said was really dry. I would have thought they'd have more souvlaki options on the menu (like a platter with sides versus a sandwich) and found the menu limited. I ordered the branzino which was very good but extremely oily. There was so much olive oil on that thing that I felt pretty disgusting at the end of it. We had a crappy table in the middle of the restaurant and kept getting pushed around by rushed waiters. Not the best experience. My husband went to use the bathroom and was grossed out by how yucky it was so better to hold it in!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: *wam feta (tomato, anchiovy, caper, roasted pepper, olives, pita bread; omg!!!!!! I loved this appetizer! The acidity of everything went so well with the tangy, melted feta cheese. The achiovy took this dish to another level though, loved it! great portion size as well, definitely not cheating you out)*grilled octopus, bean salad (HOLD THE PHONE! the grilled octopus had such an amazing tenderness to it, it was meaty, soft and not tough at all like some other places that overcook their octopus. such a great smokey flavor from the grill. the bean salad with the vinaigrette complimented the seafood so well. could eat this all day!)*sheep's milk dumplings (the dumplings were amazing!!!!!! they were like marshmallows in a bath of garlicky, tomatoey goodness. I loved the texture of the dumplings, so soft and fluffy. the spicy lamb sausage was so good!! can definitely taste the lamb meat but it wasn't gamey at all; the sausage was small and chopped into small rounds that was found throughout the dish; the sauce was absolutely delicious!!!!!!!!!! please ask for more bread to soak it up, don't waste this sauce!!!!! this dish is such a comfort food; it's filling but not overwhelming like heavy pasta dishes)This place is adorable with their decor. The entrance is nice with the bar area and the formal dining area is cozy. Service is good and friendly. The bathroom is surprisingly so clean haha. In regards to their food, such great quality and so fresh. I would go back here in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Author: N P.
Reviews.Content: When we go to a restaurant we hope to not only enjoy the food, but also to enjoy the overall experience. and when we leave a restaurant, we usually ask- will we be back? The answer with Kefi is no, here's why...we thought the food was ok,  but not memorable, but the experience they delivered was just bland and plain boring.First the good: ..appetizers- the Cypriot salad was a refreshing, very enjoyable light summer salad,  the grilled octopus is good- not chewy, perfect char, with a touch of lemon. Service was efficient and pleasant. Ok so what is not to like? The main dishes we ordered were clumsily presented, over stuffed with chips, and a soggy salad like you would get at a college food truck. The entrees- chicken souvlaki and the lamb burger were just ok. Our biggest dislike was the way the restaurant looked and was laid out. Tables jammed together, hard services, little in the way of decor that reminds you that you are eating at a Greek Restaurant, in other words it has ZERO Greek charm, soul or ambiance. To make matters worse, we were sent to the Kefi basement to eat (even though there were plenty of open tables upstairs). And no surprise here, the Kefi basement smells like ....a musty basement. Also, when sitting downstairs, expect to be in very close proximity with other people (who were banished to the musty basement), and expect to watch the kitchen staff move dirty dishes back and forth while you eat. I mean it was a saddest spot, bleak and bland...not even a little candle to cheer us up. Needless to say, we skipped desert to go up for air.

Reviews.Author: Kristen T.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is a great place to go, especially if you're from a place without good Greek food-- like me. My family and I tend to eat family style, and everything I tasted was fantastic. My only complaint is that I had too much of their tasty bread and dipping sauces to finish my meal!

Reviews.Author: Trisha A.
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. Went there for brunch a couple of weeks ago and had a whole grilled Branzino. It was cooked to perfection that it just melt in my mouth.

Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: The food and the service were top notch.  We enjoyed the combinations of meats, cheeses and the presentation.  The staff was funny, informative and friendly.Will be back!!

Reviews.Author: Jaci H.
Reviews.Content: Kefi certainly has a reputation for good food and it's nice to know it really lives up to the hype.My UWS friends brought me here yesterday for an early dinner at around 6:30pm.  It's a large space and were thrilled to be seated without issue.  I had no idea there was so much room, be sure to check out the downstairs. Our server was extremely helpful, cheerful and knowledgable with the food and wines being offered.  He recommended a delicious, refreshing and affordable ($30 per bottle) white wine. We skipped appetizers in hopes of enjoying dessert - which we didn't because we were far too full from dinner.  Will have to come back since the desserts looked divine. I ordered the Chicken Thigh Souvlaki special, which was unbelievably delicious. Tender, perfectly grilled chunks of chicken thigh were presented on wooden skewers.  It was a very hearty portion and each bite was pure bliss with the accompanying pita bread, Greek salad (which they were kind enough to present without feta cheese) and a delicious rice.  The salad was fresh and flavorful with lots of olives, tomatoes, onions and peppers.  Loved the salad dressing! The rice was amazing with a butter flavor and spinach.  I literally couldn't stop eating... and ended up cleaning my plate.  If you could have seen the food baby!   I could have easily taken home about a third of the dish but opted to pigging out while the food was fresh.  My friends also thoroughly enjoyed the dinners, ordered the same as me.  We were thrilled with Kefi and will definitely return in the near future.  Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Conrad N.
Reviews.Content: We got there around 1:30pm and the place was packed!!  It's 4th of july long weekend, and fifa was on with germany vs france.  They have massive tv that broadcast the game, so that might explain why its so packed.We ordered grilled octopus, it came with chickpea salad.  omg.  I loved it!!!!  I also ordered a chicken souvlaki wrap with a side of kefi salad.  It is a lot of food!Normally those sandwich comes with home made chips and salad...but I didnt want any chips and ot was perfect for me.  My husband loved the chips too.I will definitely go back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Kai N.
Reviews.Content: Walked in on a Monday night. We were able to walk in and seated with no reservations. It was busy, so the servers gave us ample time and extra bread and water before our order was taken. We ordered the braised rabbit pasta, lamb shank, chicken skewers special, and the grilled octopus for an appetizer. The lamb was flavorless. I've never had rabbit before, but it taste more or less like the lamb shank. Yup, unfortunately the chicken skewers is the best plate on the table. We asked for the dessert menu, but nothing jump out at us. Plus, our main course did not leave us wanting more, so we left.The place looks better than the food taste. Would only come back if I'm in the area next time for a drink at the marble top bar with ESPN on the screens.

Reviews.Author: Jeff O.
Reviews.Content: HOW HAVE I NEVER REVIEWED KEFI I'M SORRY KEFI FORGIVE ME.OK deep breaths. Straight-up, we've dined here around 25 or 30 times, and we're the kind of people who visit a restaurant twice only if it's really good. So yeah.I'm not going to get into specifics because you can't go wrong - if a dish sounds good to you, trust me, it will be good. OK one example - even the damn tzatziki sauce will blow your mind. Tzatziki is one of those things you think can only be so good and is the same everywhere, but you're freaking wrong, it can pretty much change your life if you infuse it with unicorns and rainbows, as I'm pretty sure Kefi does.Last point: the prices are crazy reasonable, like unreasonably reasonable. Win win win.

Reviews.Author: Erica D.
Reviews.Content: Our server was so fantastic tonight. We came with a group of 12 and he had just the right amount of helpfulness and "leave us alone-ness" that we needed. He made excellent wine recommendations, excellent food pacing recommendations and made our gathering just right. I was looking for a place with great service, good food and a quiet room. We sat downstairs in the "back room". It was noisy on a Sat night but not overly so. Food was a little too oily.

Reviews.Author: Alisa G.
Reviews.Content: Tasty and reasonably-priced.  We ordered 4 meze, no entrees or dessert (although I wish I'd looked at the dessert menu before we decided to go out for froyo!).  The Greek sausage was the standout, but the pickled beet salad and warm feta dish were also excellent.  The only dish that was a disappointing was the grilled calamari with beans. Way too many beans (chickpeas), and not enough flavor.  Mint cocktail was also delish!  The servers, runners, and bussers were friendly and attentive.  We sat downstairs, which I would recommend, b/c it's much quieter.  I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Noura Andréa A.
Reviews.Content: I love Greek/Mediterranean food. And given that I'm from Lebanon, I know a thing or two about the food. I was pleasantly surprised with the food at KEFI.I ordered the eggplant and bulgur fritters, with tahini sauce and pita bread. Whenever I read the word "fritters", I get chills and expect a very greasy and crunchy food that will make me feel sick all night long. Tahini sauce is my enemy because they just put too much of it. And your "falafel" ends up swimming in the sauce.I ordered the plate with fingers crossed and got a beautiful result. I got a gluten-free (yes that's an option) pita bread and some tahini very lightly (yet enough for flavor) spread on it. The fritters were marvelous! Lightly crunchy on the outside and so sweet and tender on the inside. Your knife just slides through it. The salad is well seasoned, nothing is too salty or greasy.The sandwiches are served with salad and chips. I didn't try the chips because that's not my cup of tea.The people with me were also enjoying their food, fish and meat.This is a place I would definitely go to again.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: I was really expecting this meal to wow me but i didn't get that feeling. Everything was good, no real complaints. The sangria was terrible though. We all kinda laughed about the taste, comparing it to HI-C. Pretty loud inside on a Friday night. Loud for my parents, but would be better for a night out with friends. If you want less noise I suggest trying downstairs. Service was decent. We ordered an appetizer without Pine Nuts, specifically mentioning an allergy to the waiter but when the dumplings came out I spotted a pine nut luckily before my boyfriend ate it. No real apology, they just replaced it. Going to stick with Bodrum because nothing compares!

Reviews.Author: Eponine J.
Reviews.Content: Before 6pm, they offer a prix fixe dinner menu for $17 which includes an app, entree and dessert. The two of us ordered mussels, meatball, branzino (+5 extra charge), pork medallions, walnut cake and rice pudding from the prix fixe and selection of spreads to start with. Everything was perfectly cooked but the selection of spreads and branzino definitely stood out.They also have a three-course chef tasting menu for $35, on top of which you can add a pasta course for an extra $7.

Reviews.Author: Eytan S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing dinner specialties that will fill your mouth with flavor! Get the sheep milk dumplings, feel like pillows in your mouth. I'm full!Bon appetite

Reviews.Author: Risa H.
Reviews.Content: Came here to eat one night, found the place through none other than Yelp!  I love lamb and anything spicy, so I had to try the Sheep's Milk Dumplings with Spicy Lamb Sausage.  It was VERY flavorful, a bit on the salty side, but still delicious.  I would have preferred an atmosphere with not so much lighting, but the food was still good.  Waiter brought the food out quicker than expected.  Bathrooms are located downstairs and there is a separate dining area downstairs with more of the ambiance I like in a restaurant (there was a private party down there).  Would come back to eat if I was in the area!

Reviews.Author: Joanna L.
Reviews.Content: I loved the way this place use to be....they gutted it since the last time i went. Its way more modern which is cool too but i was more of a fan of the old Kefi..but that's just me. The hostess was ok with my group. We didn't have a reservation so she said it would be 20min. Cool... But she didn't tell us where to wait or if we got a buzzer or how it would work when it was our turn to be sat. Very awkward. There's sooooo many restaurants in NYC with their own methods of seating and hostessing that I feel its the hosts responsibility to let the guests know what to do while they wait and where to go...right?? Anyways... I asked where to go and she said we can have a seat at the bar or go outside. We went to the bar and sat there...we were going to order drinks from the bartender and pay for them upfront before we got sat but the bartender was clearly under the impression that we were just taking up seats in her bar while waiting for our table because she never even looked at us...awkward again because If we didn't want drinks we would of waited outside for our table.We got our table in about 15min which was nice but then to cut this review short....we got sat next to a table that was being very rude to the waiter and so therefore, the waiter came to our table to take our order and drop off drinks ONCE...he stayed away from our area because of the other table...with that being said...you can imagine how asking for the check and paying out went...not well. I'll definitely be back for grandmas meatball.... AND to give this place another shot because our situation was unique so its only fair to try it out again...

Reviews.Author: Lesley C.
Reviews.Content: Loved the lamb chaps! Cooked to perfection.

Reviews.Author: Victoria B.
Reviews.Content: Great food, the sheep milk dumplings everyone is raving about is amazing, grilled octopus tender and smoky, dips taste authentic. The vegetable side was quite oily, but still tasty. An allover good experience, will be back for the dumplings.

Reviews.Author: A P.
Reviews.Content: Well this place was insanely disappointing.  This was a Yelp fail... don't know what other reviewers were doing but wow it was bad.  Menu was not descriptive and we have food allergies so this is a problem.  We got a dish that didn't list tomato where it was the primary ingredient.  Instead of being polite and offering to take the dish away and replace with something else the incompetent waitress argued over whether the menu listed tomato for the dish - which it didn't - she confirmed later.  She slid the fish onto a plate and told us to pick around and then brought tough broccoli as a substitute.  She was just really bad.  She also brought a salad with peppers and again we can't eat those and was annoyed when I sent it back.  The waitress did almost nothing and the poor bus boys did most of the work.  We were charged for the full $18.95 fish even though we couldn't eat half of it.  My chicken with skin, on the bone, was extremely dry.  Impressive that someone can fail at making roast chicken.  DO NOT GO HERE or be prepared to be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Mediterranean food here.  To start we had an octopus appetizer and a several spreads with pita. For our main course we had a whole fish with broccoli rabe and a lemon chicken dish. I would order the fish again. We are looking forward to exploring the menu.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious and affordable would be the two best words to describe this place. We ordered about a half dozen appetizers to share between two couples, and every last thing was delicious. The grilled octopus though was, by far, the highlight. Perfectly cooked, slightly tender and well seasoned, it was maybe the best grilled octopus I've ever had. Two bottles of wine and a table full of food, and our bill was less than $130 total. We'll be back.

Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: Incredible. Greek food is underrated and Kefi is a gem in the Upper West Side. This place simply blows Taverna straight out of the Mediterranean waters. The friendly, attentive staff made sure we were always taken care of and there seems to be plenty of space (multiple floors). Never order chicken at a Greek restaurant...that said, I personally don't eat lamb but can attest to the excellent seafood quality. The grilled octopus was tender and fresh...almost tasted like some type of forbidden land protein. The pita appetizer is a home run too. Multiple difference sauces, all incredibly flavorful. Free refill on the basket just in case too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Sarah F.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like it here but found the food lacking. My octopus appetizer was burnt pretty badly, and was sitting on a bed of chick peas so heavily covered in parsley I was picking it out of my teeth for a whole day. I'm not sure that the swordfish I ordered was fully cooked. I had a pretty hard time cutting into it, and it was fairly translucent and clear looking in the middle as opposed to white and cooked. The price was reasonable but I would rather spend a little more to really enjoy my food. Great selection of Greek wines, though.

Reviews.Author: Kendrick W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious.  That's my memory of this place.  I came on a stormy night, an hour late meeting my friends because my plane was so delayed and this place quickly made me forget it all.  The moment I sat down, the waitress came right over, took my drink order and even recommended some dishes.  I had the sheep milk ricotta ravioli and it was like butter in my mouth.  So creamy and good.  My only complaint was that I felt the portion was a little small, which is unusual for greek places.  But absolutely tasty.  Also the meatballs.  Perfection.  I was a little underwhelmed by the Sangria, but other than that no real complaints.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: If your in the UWS the place to go for Greek food would be here. Large restaurant with a downstairs and upstairs. Decor is standard and doesn't wow you and even with a reservation prepare for a bit of a wait.You come here for the greek food. Great apps with hummus and yogurt and their Octopus was grilled perfectly. Had the pressed chicken and it was made great and very flavorful with a bit of crunch from the pressing. If in the area i would stop in again.

Reviews.Author: Alisa L.
Reviews.Content: 1.5 years.  The approximate amount of time Zachary Taylor was in office, or the amount of time I went without Kefi due to its closure/being busy and no longer living in MoHi.The answer is both, but alas, absence did not make the heart grow fonder once we were reunited.To be fair, the food itself was decent, albeit not as good as I remembered.  The sheep's dumplings were merely okay but the sauce was very flavorful, just begging to be scooped up by an extra order of bread.  The lamb burger was also average at best, nothing special and honestly, there are many better burgers in the neighborhood.So far, the restaurant is probably earning a solid 3 stars, but then what merited the drop?The service, oh god, the service.  The food took something like 45 minutes to come, while dessert, which was nothing special and shouldn't have taken that long, took 20.  Any request required attempting to flag down a waiter, already incredibly difficult, and actually ensuring the waiter remembered your request by re-flagging him down and reminding him.  The ambiance was also lacking, especially in the basement.  There was an old moldy smell, though it was very faint, and the place just seemed unappealing.  Perhaps it was the lighting, or the setup of the basement, but this place has definitely lost its charm.

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch. If you're a feta fan + mussels fan, get the mussels for the appetizer. It was incredibly good, especially when you dip the bread in the sauce... woah man! We followed the yelper's recommendation and get ourselves the lamb shank. Very delicious, but because of how salty/flavorful the mussels were, it almost overpowered the taste of the lamb shank. So keep that in mind as you're making your choice. My brother had the kefi burger. That thing is HUGE. Not a fan that you have to add money for cheese (who does that?!) but when you have an option to add feta in a burger... go for it! I like this a lot! Cool interior, we had a very early lunch so no one was there yet so that was nice since my family and I wanted to get away from the business of Manhattan... we're tourists...you see...

Reviews.Author: Steve R.
Reviews.Content: I had a quite different experience from other Yelpers, because Kefi is way below par... somewhere in the double bogey range. If you must go, I suggest insisting on sitting upstairs, and if you cannot wait for a table there, leave. Downstairs is a loud, windowless, dining area where I felt herded in, like a tourist getting off a bus. In fact, the large groups sitting in another downstairs section, seemed to follow that description. The tables are small, crammed together and it is hard to hear your partner. Guests have to speak loud to be heard, so we couldn't help hearing what our neighbors were saying. It took 45 minutes to get appetizers. The often praised grilled octopus was tender, but it had no taste or brininess to it, as if you couldn't tell it ever came from the sea. Tasted like chicken. The warm feta was good, but I could do that at home. An hour in, we were told that they were out of dumplings, which was the sole reason we went there. Why wait an hour? FAIL. We finally got our good quality lamb chops, under-seasoned and over-grilled, poorly presented on a bed of greens in dire need of flavor. We should have listened to our neighborhood friends and hotel front desk people who didn't suggest Kefi. It really was a letdown.

Reviews.Author: Tara J.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch on a Saturday with my boyfriend, parents, and a friend, and was disappointed that the service and staff were so bad, it almost ruined the good food. First, due to miscommunication on our part, we made two reservations for 5 people. When we got there -on time-, there was no table available for us, and we had to wait for almost 40 minutes for a table to be cleared. How did they not plan for that? What's the point in making a reservation? The manager tried to help but didn't do anything to speed up the process.Then once we sat, it took forever for our waitress to get to us, and then even longer for our food to come out - even though by that time we had told the waitress we were in a rush because we had plans to get to. I ordered some kind of breakfast sandwich with eggs, cheese, tomato, and bacon, on a giant loaf of bread. This was the messiest sandwich I've ever eaten, and the bread was way too large. I had to cut it up just to manage it, but the flavors were delicious. Everyone else enjoyed their food, but also was disappointed by the service. Despite the awful service, I really enjoyed the food and I would give this a second chance.

Reviews.Author: Yon L.
Reviews.Content: Come here by 12pm for brunch and it won't be crowded. It starts getting hectic around 1pm. LOVED the Sheep Milk dumplings. The tomato basil lamb sauce complimented these little treasures so well! The Greek spread was also yums. Really fresh and on point. I can't seem to find it on their menu online, but there was a GREAT Prawns dish on a bed of some grain... I don't know what it's called so this is frustrating, but they were small round bits... larger than quinoa. Reallly well cooked prawns and the other stuff was delicious too. haha.Was not a fan of the Greek Meat and Potato omelette. It was huge but the eggs were overcooked and dry. The sausage was tasty though but this dish definitely went back half finished. Service was great until the 1pm rush. Then our Bottomless mimosas turned into no mimosas for half an hour. Talk about a buzz kill. I'd go back...earlier.

Reviews.Author: Rachel B.
Reviews.Content: Since moving to the UWS 10 months ago I had been waiting for Kefi to reopen. Many of my friends had recommended the place to me. So, I was thrilled when I managed to secure a reservation last Friday night. Maybe its because the place had been so hyped, but I wasn't overly impressed with my meal. It was good... but nothing I would run back for. The grilled octopus was probably the best dish we tried. But, the rapine was waaay too oily and my simple grilled fish also tasted bathed in oil and butter. The special pasta dish made with a pulled pork was also pretty darn good, but its not that hard to get a good pasta dish in this city.It was also packed that night and we felt a bit rushed by the waitstaff, but that's understandable on a Friday night, and forgivable. Although, jamming so many diners into such a small space and constantly having the waitstaff bump into you really isn't the most preferable way to enjoy a meal. They might want to take out a table, or 3 or 4. The dining room is just so packed.I'm going to give Kefi another try. Hopefully, they were just a bit off that night. And the next time I'll see what all the hype is about and enjoy a great meal.

Reviews.Author: lauren l.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!  Firstly, we sat at the bar to have drinks and snacks.   It was literally at least 5 minutes before we were acknowledged by the bartender.    She was busy, but a good bartender would know to at least say "Hello, be with you soon."  No.  She walked back and forth and didn't even glance at us.Next-the food.   The dips were BAD!  So surprising because these are not that difficult to get right.  We won't be going back there.

Reviews.Author: Kara L.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Saturday for dinner with my best friend, and the food was so amazing it made up for some of the restaurants weak points.Since the "remodel" kefi has less of a intimate feeling and more of a get in and get out vibe. The two top I sat at was SO close to the table next to us I felt like they were part of our conversation. Also, both my table, and the table next to us ordered appetizers that never came out. My friend and I ordered the tzatziki, hummus, lamb shank, and striped bass which were All amazing. Our grilled octopus never made it to the table, but I saw others eating it and it looked good. I also had a glass of red sangria which was awful, it reminded me of a cheap juice I drank when I was little.The food is worth checking out as long as they keep the idea of quality, not quantity in mind. Also, make a reservation, this place gets packed fast!

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: The food is not bad; it is no longer consistent and good.  The selection is still ... OK to good.  Those are now the only nice (nice-ish) things I can say about a restaurant I used to enjoy weekly, sometimes more often.   Kefi was damaged and spent a few months rebuilding.  When they were closed they lost nearly all of there staff ... and a restaurant takes a team like atmosphere to succeed.   I have been back to Kefi a few times since their reopening, brunch and dinner, and they have failed me every time.  They have problems from management to wait staff to bartenders.   It is a shame. The managment has consistently over booked and understaffed the restaurant while not having trained their staff adequately.  I feel sorry for the people that work there because they are not being given an environment to succeed, let alone excel.

Reviews.Author: P L.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance: This is a nice casual place to grab a bite to eat. Not pretentious and the staff was very nice and friendly. The manager also came up to us during our meal to make sure everything was okay and if we needed anything.The give bread at the table however since the bread is out before you sit down and seems to have been there for a bit, it was rock hard. We asked for fresher bread which they provided with no problem.We ordered the goat cheese dumplings with spicy lamb sausage-the sauce was very good and the dumplings were soft and pillowy and yummy. The only negative of the dish was the lamb sausage which was very hard and tasted funny.We also ordered the chicken sandwich and the chickpea fritter sandwich. Both were good and came with homemade chips and salad. Con: salad was a bit limp and overly covered with dressing.Overall, a good dining experience- you can be in and out in under an hour. I would go back again.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: This review is based not on the food, which was delicious, but some of the most disorganized and chaotic service ever.  Four of us arrived at 7 pm for a birthday dinner and soon after ordered drinks.  45 minutes later I had mine but my friends had not.  One had ordered a virgin bloody mary and the two others vodka on the rocks.  Not complicated.  About 7.55 our appetizers arrived.  Still no more drinks.  We were told after repeated requests that the bar, which was in front of us, was backed up and the waiter himself could not make the drinks.  There was one bartender.  Then waiters seemed to gather to try to sort the mess, the bartender left, and finally the manager stepped in, very late in the game.  We all got drinks about the time the entree arrived.  Why the manager did not see what was going on and step in we could not understand.  It was a train wreck.  And by the way our waiter, who was doing the best he could, delivered the vodka on the rocks with a lemon twist with a lime wedge instead.  Under the circumstances we felt lucky to have drinks at all.  Quite a shockingly bad experience for a good restaurant and not at all appropriate to the quality of the food which was great.

Reviews.Author: chip h.
Reviews.Content: The Octopus is still Amazing!!!!  Some people are complaining about the service but I'm sure as soon as the new servers become better seasoned that will no longer be an issue.  I am not a fan of the upstairs so I always have a few cocktails next door at Prohibition while I wait for a table downstairs.  Upstairs (very loud and congested), Downstairs (Cozy and much quieter).  The Lamb shank was still delicious and everyone at my table enjoyed their meal.  The service was a bit on the slow side but the guy was super friendly and trying his best so no big deal.  Love it......Sit downstairs.....Get the Octopus!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Tracey M.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place a lot. They're a little slow at the checkin desk... But they totally make up with it for the good fresh food and the robust menu. If you can get there before 6 o'clock they have a prefix menu that first $17 gets you an appetizer an entrée and a dessert. For New York -- that's amazing.

Reviews.Author: Erum R.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the hype is about. I came here for dinner one night with the hubby and was not pleased. You'd think they have an amazing menu because the wait was about 45 minutes for a Thursday night but it really was not so impressive.Husband had the chicken souvlaki sandwich which he said was really dry. I would have thought they'd have more souvlaki options on the menu (like a platter with sides versus a sandwich) and found the menu limited. I ordered the branzino which was very good but extremely oily. There was so much olive oil on that thing that I felt pretty disgusting at the end of it. We had a crappy table in the middle of the restaurant and kept getting pushed around by rushed waiters. Not the best experience. My husband went to use the bathroom and was grossed out by how yucky it was so better to hold it in!

Reviews.Author: Zaman K.
Reviews.Content: Ever since Michael Psilakis opened MP Taverna in Astoria, I've been a fan and have wanted to try out some of his other restaurants, mainly Kefi.  We got word that it had finally reopened after being closed for so long and we wasted no time in booking a table.This place is popular so reservations are a must.  Even though they had barely been open a week,  it was packed inside. The menu seems more casual than MP Taverna. Once again my wife and I ordered more than we should have. Grilled Octopus with Bean Salad: I couldn't help but compare the grilled octopus here with MP Taverna's. Both have a perfectly soft texture inside but the one at Kefi was over charred. Some people may like this version, but I think there is an ideal amount of char that makes a dish taste great and anything above that is overkill. Still very good though. 4/5Sweetbreads, spinach, shallots, garlic:  I love sweetbreads - especially chunky, mouthful of sweetbreads.  The spinach gave the dish good balance and the fried shallots provided the texture. 4/5Chef's app plate: This wasn't on the menu but since we mentioned Kefi on Facebook, we got a free app from the kitchen. The app plate consisted of four kinds of dipping sauce: chickpeas, tzatziki, caviar and eggplant. They were all good. I was surprised by how much mint there was in the chickpeas but it tasted refreshing. The tzatziki was among some of the best I've had. 4/5Flat pasta, pulled braised rabbit, graviera cheese: I realized that I'm not a huge fan of graviera cheese because it's a bit too sweet and fruity for my liking but the braised rabbit was so good that it didn't bother me too much. The pasta was thin, wide and flat. It's hard to maintain the texture for this kind of pasta but they were able to. A light tomato sauce brought the dish together 4/5Sheep's milk dumplings, tomato, pine nuts, spicy lamb sausage:  This was my favorite dish of the night but I'm partial to all things spicy. All the flavors were bold and the spicy lamb sausage was basically very good quality merguez. There was a lot of tomato sauce present throughout this dish which paired very well with the sausage and the excellent dumplings. 5/5After eating so much food, we obviously didn't have room for dessert, but much of the dessert menu looked similar to MP Taverna's so we left with no regret.  The restaurant is pretty casual but downstairs, where we sat, it was better to come in a group of 4 than 2 because of the way the tables were spaced. They had the tables of 2 on one side which were very close to one another and tables of 4 on another side which had more space in between. They should have tables of 2 and 4 on either side.  Service was good throughout.Glad we made the trip to UWS for this. It's an area we don't come to too often but Kefi was certainly a good reason to go up there.

Reviews.Author: Erin D.
Reviews.Content: I feel like I'm cheating on my chosen people in the Upper West Side when I sneak into Kefi to devour their huge, succulent, absolutely-couldn't-be-more-perfectly grilled shrimp. So tender. Scattered generously over the orange citrus salad, it's easily one of the most delicious, naughty non-kosher lunches to be had in this part of town. It's hard to believe I spent almost the same price for a boring over-chopped make-your-own salad next door at Lenny's.... eh. The egg dishes on the lunch menu pale in comparison to the grilled meats, wraps, and assorted dips. At $11 with a Greek salad included, the frittata is a good deal, but pass it up. Get the mezze appetizer, and dig in with their warm grilled pita points - the fish egg spread is other-worldly. Kefi also has notably good service, with waiters that hail from the homeland and know their stuff.Get 'em to the Greek.

Reviews.Author: Meredith X.
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a fan of Greek/Mediterranean food. My palette is more accustomed to a bombardment of flavors and spices. Kefi's emphasis on basic, high quality, lightly dressed ingredients has changed my perspective!Came here with a bud the other weekend, chat bond time over glasses of sangria and cab. We ordered the grilled octopus, pickled beet salad, tasting of spreads, and sheep's milk dumplings. By far, my favorites were the grilled octopus and dumplings. Octopus perfectly charred, hint of lemon, atop a bean salad, both hearty and refreshing. The dumplings were an indulgence, pillowy dumplings nestled in a rich and thick tomato sauce, topped with fresh feta cheese. The only drawback I would note is that it was difficult at times to find our server. Place was busy as hell though so I'm sure his hands were full. A lively, bustling spot, Kefi has inspired me to explore more of the UWS.

Reviews.Author: Julie E.
Reviews.Content: Meh. Sangria was good but service was slow. Food was only okay. I live in Salt Lake City and was really surprised how far the quality of what is considered "good Greek" in NYC compares to that I SLC.

Reviews.Author: Woo L.
Reviews.Content: Pros- octopus was still good- cleanCons- loud music- music selection didn't fit the cuisine (techno-ish)- the rest of the food was between "meh" to too salty- waiter was too busy and rushed us- waitstaff seemed to just be lounging around- lighting and decor is all wrongSummary:I used to love coming here before the renovation. Now it's not even an option.

Reviews.Author: Meenie M.
Reviews.Content: Seems to always be busy! Got reservations at 8:45, got seated at 9:20 that was kind of a bummer, service was nice, food was tasty, dessert was yummy... Prices are very reasonable!

Reviews.Author: Am I.
Reviews.Content: 4 Stars for the food! We had a large group celebrating an important milestone for two friends, and all the food was fantastic! 1 Star for the service.  I don't think I have ever met a waiter that has hated his life so much. Which is sad, because even though we don't drink, we eat, a lot, at the end of the day, we aren't bashful, and we order lots of things to try. This guy literally hated his life.  I don't know if he was just having a terrible day or whatever, but, dude, it's your job. Fake it.

Reviews.Author: Jane N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Greek food. The ambiance is wonderful especially downstairs. Great place for a date. It is affordable and fun to share a few dishes and enjoy family style. Great restaurant, glad it has finally reopened!

Reviews.Author: Gee P.
Reviews.Content: Walking out of a restaurant after being seated is embarrassing. I would rather have never experienced it. Last night, we did just that.Kefi, is loud and the lighting is horrible. I made a reservation there for my fiancé's birthday. I felt extremely terrible about it as soon as we walked in.The restaurant felt more like a fast food chain with florescent lighting. The crammed us in a hallway in the basement thinking that was okay. Me fiancé sat on the bench literally rubbing elbows with the other patrons on a seat barely 6 inches deep. Maybe the food is good but the ambience is just so awful I don't think it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Lori L.
Reviews.Content: In an area that isn't exactly known for its culinary landscape, Kefi is quite the gem in the Upper West Side neighborhood. With Michael Psilakis, one of the forefront chefs in Greek cuisine, heading the kitchen, all it took was a quick skim of the menu before I promptly made a reservation for brunch.Conveniently located next to both 86th Street Stations (the 1 and A/B/C), Kefi has one of the most deceptive entrances. The actual doorway is extremely narrow and easy to pass by, but enter, and you'll set eyes on a large, high-ceiling dining room with far too many tables to count. Even better, Kefi has a lower level that can accommodate larger parties and serves as venue for private events. We were quickly seated at a two-top near the front and given the brunch and specials menu. For those that enjoy it, Kefi does offer a "bottomless brunch" option, which gives diners a (hypothetically) unlimited number of glasses of mimosa, sangria, or bloody mary's to accompany their meal.We started off with an order of the Albondigas, a traditional Spanish meatball dish that was given a few splashes of Greek cuisine. The meatballs (4 pieces) were tender and full of flavor, a combination of ground pork and lamb seasoned with plenty of garlic, parsley, and dill. The tomato sauce that came with it had the requisite Italian garnishes of onions, garlic, and bay leaves, with a hint of red wine, but also came strewn with tsakistes and kalamata olives. It wasn't a pairing I initially would have thought of, but the tartness and slight bitterness from this addition complimented the dish well.For the main course, we opted to share two of Kefi's signature dishes: the Kefi burger and the Sheep's Milk Dumplings. The burger was one of the better ones I've had; there's some brisket mixed into the beef, which adds an additional layer of juiciness into the patty. Cooked to a medium rare, topped with a generous layer of feta cheese, and finally sandwiched between two halves of ciabatta, it's an impressive piece of work, especially when paired with a Greek salad and a pile of french fries on the side. The Sheep's Milk Dumplings were also a solid dish, though one that seemed as though it had been hastily conceived. It's a Greek pasta dish, featuring a pillowy, gnocchi-like dumpling accompanied by pine nuts, spicy lamb sausage, spinach, and a healthy dose of garlic, all cooked in a robust tomato sauce and finished off with crumbled feta cheese. It reminded me more of a casserole than an actual pasta dish, but the ingredients paired well together and made for a hearty meal.Across the board, Kefi is a solid restaurant and it's no wonder that so many, locals and non-locals, were delighted to hear of its reopening. With plenty of tasty, reasonably-priced dishes served in a such a welcoming environment, it's not difficult to see why.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence R.
Reviews.Content: I cannot, for the life of me, understand how this place gets such good reviews. I've given it 3 tries, partly because I work so close to it. Every meal has been lackluster and one dish, I even had to send back...the spaghetti with Greek bolognese. It was so sweet and cinnamony, I couldn't eat it. I know Greek food. I love Greek food. I've been to Greece twice. I've been to many Greek restaurants here in NYC. I enjoy the cuisine. I know that sweet spices are used in some savory dishes in Greek cuisine. I don't have a problem with that. But balance is everything. I don't know. Maybe I've ordered the wrong things, but if 8 dishes on your menu aren't good, that's a problem.

Reviews.Author: Lou G.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food but portions are small.  Do not go if you are very hungry.Average service, good ambience.My credentials are I'm Greek.

Reviews.Author: Mb K.
Reviews.Content: I love me some KEFI LOVE! No one was more psyched then me to see them reopen on the UWS after a long hiatus.  I could not wait to get my fix of sheeps milk dumplings more on that later. HOWEVER I don't usually write reviews but the service was so bad at our dinner last night I need to vent. We had a 8:30 reservation. We did not get seated until 9pm. Ok not a big deal. Went down down hill from there. We were sooo hungry that we told the waiter we were ready to order when he came over to ask about sparkling or flat. We will take tap thanks. He fills our water glasses and then walked AWAY. Did not come back for 15 minutes.  Then we finally get a drink order in and for our party of 6 ppl he forgets 2 of the 6 drinks.  FINALLY get our food order in. And to my dismay they were out of sheeps milk dumplings. DAMMIT.  The table seated next to us who sat down after us managed to get them. WTF.  Oh and they left well before us as well.  Apps finally come at 9:30 and they forgot one of the apps! Ordered another round of drinks and he forgets  the same 2 vodka sodas  AGAIN.  Main course is served at 10:30!!! Food got cold because we were eating family style and had to ask 3 different people for sharing plates so we just stared at it for 5 minutes.  Eating your main course dinner at 10:30 when your reservation was at 8:30? So much for having a friday night on the town.  We did not get out of there until 11:15.  Waited another 30 minutes for the check.I will never say a bad thing about the food here. The food was, is and continues to be AWESOME.  Meatballs, Sheepsmilk dumplings, Grilled octopus and the greek salad, lamb chops all winners. I would give the food 5 stars. Well priced too. But the service was beyond bad.  Awful. Worst I have had in a while.  We are not douches and still left him a 15% tip and we won't stiff the guy but he deserved 5%. He came over at one point and asked what else did we order and did not get because he clearly was in the weeds and did not have his shit together. Kefi your food rocks but your staff needs some serious help and fast. I don't think they are ramped up for a reopening.

Reviews.Author: elizabeth g.
Reviews.Content: I thought the food was really good, and the restaurant was very busy.  It had a light and open feeling to the restaurant.I ordered the sheep's milk dumplings, and they were really really enjoyable.The service wasn't wonderful, but it wasn't terrible either.I'd definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: Edited 12/29.First tried to get in as a party of 2 on Friday 12/20.  Was told that there was a 30-45 min wait.  No problem, we'll walk around for a bit and come back.  Came back after 20-25 minutes and were told it would be another 10-15 minutes.  Then we waited.  And waited.  And waited.  30 minutes later, we asked for an update and were told it would be another 30-40 minutes.  We said "Fuck you very much" and went to B Cafe instead (which is consistently awesome).  Fast forward to 12/28.  Our group of 7 had 8:45 reservations.  We finally were seated around 10:15.  Of course, by 10:15 they were already out of the sheep milk ravioli... something tells me if we got seated on time, there would have been some left.  Also, we had 2 people order branzino and the rest order the dumplings.  They brought us 6 orders of branzino instead.  So yeah, a lot was lacking.That being said, they did fess up to screwing up left and right, and wound up comping most of our meal (total for 7 people, including appetizers, entrees, and multiple drinks each was around $80).  The dumplings entree and meatball appetizer were out of this world good (pro tip - if you have the sauce that accompanies the dumplings left over, take it home and use it as a dip for chips the next day).  The pita and dips were pretty good also.  Greek salad was average.  All in all, the food is good enough to merit another try, but they clearly have no clue what they're doing seating-wise.  Kefi, you get one more chance with me... don't screw it up.

Reviews.Author: Mi W.
Reviews.Content: The food has been consistently good. The staff are always nice and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Geoff W.
Reviews.Content: Kefi was not ready to reopen.I ordered food from the bar and it took over an hour. The bartender and manager had no idea when the food would be ready. Because the food took so long, they tried to sell me some additional starters. When the food finally came, it was good. The person next to me was served very cold food. I hope things get better because this place used to be great.

Reviews.Author: Steve N.
Reviews.Content: I'll add my fuel to the fire for this place, which is getting all the love it deserves from Yelpers, seeing that there's more than 700 reviews and four stars.Here's my first visit details, the tips and the bonuses:Warm feta starter ($7.95): More bread than toppings. My tip: skip.Crispy calamari ($7.95): If you like calamari, this is fine. The tzatziki sauce is a nice change. We sopped that up with the bread from the first starter.Sheep's milk dumplings with spicy lamb sausage and pine nuts ($14.50): This has a spicy tomato sauce, lots of feta, and rich, fluffly dumplings shaped like small pillows with chunks of lamb sausage mixed in. Sea bass with Brussels sprouts and potatoes ($17.95): Crispy skin highlighted the perfectly-cooked fish served in an nice-sized portion.
